Starlink, our revolutionary satellite constellation, is delivering low-latency broadband internet around the world. Whether responding to natural disasters or extraordinary circumstances, Starlink has repeatedly provided critical communications in exceptional circumstances. We are looking for an adept and versatile individual to assist with preparations and play a significant role in facilitating our responses. Develop and Implement Engagement Strategies: Create strategies to support crisis response organizations, ensuring seamless onboarding, account management, and long-term customer success.
Deliver Exceptional Customer Service: Provide high-quality customer support at scale to crisis response customers and resellers, ensuring their needs are met under tight operational constraints.
Strengthen Relationships and Identify Needs: Work closely with emergency response stakeholders to understand operational requirements, technical constraints, and mission-critical objectives.
Advocate for Customer Needs Internally: Translate field insights into actionable improvements for Starlink products and services that enhance response capabilities during disasters and emergencies.

Streamline Processes: Identify and implement process and system improvements to enhance execution across cross-functional teams and improve crisis response support.

Bachelors degree OR high school diploma/equivalency certificate with 5+ years of professional experience in emergency/crisis response.
2+ years of consulting, project management, or crisis response coordination experience.
1+ year of experience in a customer/external-facing role.

PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

1+ year experience with Starlink equipment and systems.
Ability to manage multiple high-pressure projects with tight deadlines and limited resources. Demonstrated ability to solve problems with a proactive and solutions-driven mindset.
Direct experience in emergency response, military, firefighting, law enforcement, or emergency management, including experience working outside of the United States.
Experience working in a crisis with local, state, and federal emergency response agencies (e.g., FEMA, state emergency management offices, National Guard, fire departments, law enforcement, or private/non-profit organizations).
Strong understanding of disaster response frameworks, interagency coordination, emergency communications, emergency logistics, incident command systems (ICS), or large-scale disaster response.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including experience delivering professional briefings or reports.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Perform complex technical assignments involving instrumentation and data acquisition/processing systems
Maintain, calibrate, configure, monitor, test, troubleshoot, install, and repair instrumentation, process controls, data acquisition systems, and electrical systems

Analyze results of calibrations and processed data, and assist in the interpretation of test data
Adjust, repair, or replace faulty components of test setups and equipment
Lay out, build, test, troubleshoot, repair, and modify developmental and production electrical and electronic units, assemblies, components, parts, equipment, and systems

Perform continuity checks, locate and correct wiring errors using measuring instruments such as ohmmeters and sequential continuity checkers
Adjust, calibrate, align, and modify circuitry and components, and record effects on unit performance

Intermediate skill level using Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, OneNote)

Field bus networks, serial communication, and Ethernet communication

Knowledge of NEC, NFPA, UL508A codes with ability to ensure compliance with control system safety standards

PLC programming, preferably Beckhoff TwinCAT structured text programming
